intro: Glochidion moonii var. glaucogynum, commonly known as the glaucogynum glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a waxy, bluish-gray coating. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is typically found in lowland rainforests. This variant is distinguished by its unique leaf coloration and habitat preferences compared to other varieties of Glochidion.
